name: Best Vegan Banana Cake
description: This is the Best Vegan Banana Cake ever! It's incredibly moist and fluffy and topped with a simple vegan cream cheese frosting. If you have a few overripe bananas, make this easy cake!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350℉ and grease a 9x13 inch pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350℉ and grease a 9x13 inch pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Mash the bananas in a medium bowl and set aside. I just use my stand mixer for this, then set them aside in a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mash the bananas in a medium bowl and set aside. I just use my stand mixer for this, then set them aside in a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large measuring cup, add the soy milk, apple cider vinegar and ground flaxseeds. Whisk to combine, then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large measuring cup, add the soy milk, apple cider vinegar and ground flaxseeds. Whisk to combine, then set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In medium bowl, add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt and whisk to combine. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In medium bowl, add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon and salt and whisk to combine. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a stand mixer with the paddle attachment or in a large bowl using a handheld mixer, beat the vegan butter for about a minute until creamy. Now add the sugars and beat for 2 minutes until combined. Add the vanilla and mashed bananas and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: In a stand mixer with the paddle attachment or in a large bowl using a handheld mixer, beat the vegan butter for about a minute until creamy. Now add the sugars and beat for 2 minutes until combined. Add the vanilla and mashed bananas and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Alternate adding the milk/flaxseed mixture and the dry ingredients, in about three additions, mixing until each addition is just incorporated.  Do not over mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Alternate adding the milk/flaxseed mixture and the dry ingredients, in about three additions, mixing until each addition is just incorporated.  Do not over mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the cake batter to the pan and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the cake batter to the pan and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and let cool in a wire rack. Let it cool completely before frosting. I usually stick it in the refrigerator to speed this up.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and let cool in a wire rack. Let it cool completely before frosting. I usually stick it in the refrigerator to speed this up.

itemListElement.text: In the bowl of a stand mixer using a whisk attachment or a large bowl using a handheld mixer, beat the vegan cream cheese and butter together until smooth. Then add the powdered sugar and vanilla and beat, starting on low speed and increasing to high, for about 2 minutes.
itemListElement.name: In the bowl of a stand mixer using a whisk attachment or a large bowl using a handheld mixer, beat the vegan cream cheese and butter together until smooth. Then add the powdered sugar and vanilla and beat, starting on low speed and increasing to high, for about 2 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Frost the cooled cake, sprinkle with chopped walnuts or sliced bananas if desired and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Frost the cooled cake, sprinkle with chopped walnuts or sliced bananas if desired and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve. Enjoy!

keywords: banana cake recipe, vegan banana cake
